intro: Hibbertia auriculiflora subsp. minor, commonly known as the small-leafed sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers with distinctive, ear-shaped petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is often found in coastal and inland regions. The subspecies minor is distinguished by its smaller leaves and flowers compared to the main species.
